tournament.name: Japan  Cup : Dusk Mourn: House of Horror

decks.notes: This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays with a mix of disruptive spells and creature cards. The key strategy is to maintain board control and tempo by utilizing low cost spells and creatures to deal damage quickly while being able to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is built around a mixture of flying creatures, card draw, and bounce effects to keep the opponent on their toes while maintaining pressure. With a focus on efficiency and speed, this Azorius Aggro deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The key strategy involves efficiently playing creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Mosswood Dreadknight, while using removal spells like Cut Down and Go for the Throat to control the board. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Liliana of the Veil and Glissa Sunslayer adds versatility and disruption to the deck. By balancing aggression with control, the deck aims to maintain pressure on opponents and secure victories through a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells.

This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on quickly building up strong creatures with enchantments like Ethereal Armor and using evasive abilities like Fae Flight to attack aggressively. The deck also includes cards like Shardmage's Rescue and Sheltered by Ghosts to protect key creatures and maintain board presence. With a mix of powerful creatures and enchantments, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient aggression while also maintaining some defensive capabilities with cards like Restless Anchorage and Gremlin Tamer.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with low-cost creatures and pump spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage early on, supported by spells like Might of the Meek and Monstrous Rage to boost their power. The deck also includes utility cards like Turn Inside Out and Snakeskin Veil to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to push through damage quickly and efficiently to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Haughty Djinn and Abhorrent Oculus. It also includes disruptive spells like Get Lost and Phantom Interference to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its early aggression while maintaining some control over the game with cards like Three Steps Ahead and Moment of Truth. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle with access to both white and blue mana sources.

The main focus of this Boros Control deck is to establish board control and maintain tempo by utilizing removal spells like Abrade and Torch the Tower, as well as utilizing powerful creatures like Overlord of the Mistmoors and Beza, the Bounding Spring. The deck also includes some card draw and ramp options like Caretaker's Talent and Carrot Cake to ensure a steady flow of resources. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategies while still ensuring consistent access to all colors needed for its spells.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence and putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. Dimir Aggro combines evasion and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats. The key strategy is to curve out early with low-cost creatures and disruption spells, then use card advantage and tempo plays to maintain pressure and overcome the opponent's defenses. The deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Heartfire Hero, and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage efficiently. By combining cheap creatures with pump spells like Might of the Meek and Monstrous Rage, you can push through damage early and often. Additionally, Snakeskin Veil and Leyline of Resonance provide protection and additional synergy to the deck, making it a fast and formidable force on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield with a mix of creatures and spells. Utilizing cards like Optimistic Scavenger and Entity Tracker to quickly build up a threatening board presence, while also using spells like Enduring Curiosity and No More Lies to control the opponent's actions. Ethereal Armor and Sheltered by Ghosts help to boost the power of the creatures on the field, making them even more dangerous. The inclusion of Stenn, Paranoid Partisan adds a unique element to the deck, providing additional utility and options for navigating tricky situations.

The main concept of this Boros Control deck is to maintain control of the battlefield through removal spells and tempo plays, while also utilizing cards like Carrot Cake and Virtue of Loyalty to gain value over time. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Temporary Lockdown and Seal from Existence, while putting pressure on them with efficient creatures like Sunfall and Urabrask's Forge. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures that can quickly chip away at their life total. With a mixture of low-cost creatures like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat, coupled with powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Phantom Interference and Cut Down helps control the board and protect your own creatures, ensuring your aggro strategy can succeed.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Cacophony Scamp, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Support cards like Monstrous Rage and Turn Inside Out help boost your creatures' power and toughness, while spells like Might of the Meek and Snakeskin Veil protect your creatures from removal spells. The key strategy is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and efficient creatures, while utilizing Leyline of Resonance and Witch's Mark to give you additional advantages in combat. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both red and green mana sources.

The focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly build a board presence with creatures like Heartfire Hero and Monastery Swiftspear, while utilizing burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to apply relentless pressure and close out games swiftly through efficient creature attacks and burn spells, with the ability to finish off opponents with powerful finishers like Obliterating Bolt. The balance of creatures and burn spells along with the aggressive land base of Mountains ensures a fast and proactive playstyle.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with aggressive low-cost creatures like Heartfire Hero, Hired Claw, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger. The deck also includes burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike to deal direct damage to the opponent's creatures or face. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, consistent damage while maintaining a strong offensive presence on the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Monstrous Rage and Obliterating Bolt provide additional ways to push through damage and secure the win.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game by countering opponents' plays, removing threats, and stalling until the player can establish a dominant position. The deck includes a variety of control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also running a high number of defensive creatures and artifacts to protect the player's life total. The goal is to outlast the opponent and slowly grind them down while maintaining card advantage and board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, focusing on tempo and control. By playing a mix of removal spells like Go for the Throat and disfigure, along with powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Spyglass Siren, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and graveyard recursion to maintain resources and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and aggressive playstyle, using a combination of powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, Overlord of the Balemurk, and Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also includes various removal spells such as Go for the Throat and Cut Down to control the board. The mana base is designed to support the two-color Dimir deck, ensuring a steady stream of black mana to cast powerful spells. The deck focuses on maintaining pressure on the opponent and controlling the game through creature presence and removal.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control cards to manipulate the board state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By playing powerful creatures like Archangel of Wrath and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, along with spells like Get Lost and Temporary Lockdown, the deck aims to maintain board control and outmaneuver the opponent. Additionally, cards like Leyline Binding and Sunfall help to further control the battlefield, while ramping up with cards like Herd Migration and Up the Beanstalk to gain an advantage. Overall, the deck emphasizes strategic play and resource management to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of creature removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Vraska, Betrayal's Sting. The deck also utilizes cards like Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal and Mosswood Dreadknight to maintain board control and apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the Golgari color combination, allowing for consistent access to both green and black mana sources. By effectively managing resources and strategically playing threats, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and pump spells. By utilizing the synergy between creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Monstrous Rage, along with combat tricks like Snakeskin Veil and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of Leyline of Resonance and Innkeeper's Talent provides additional support and flexibility to the aggressive game plan. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that support a fast-paced playstyle, this Gruul Aggro deck is designed to apply early pressure and secure victories swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells to deal a large amount of damage quickly. The key strategy involves playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, then using pump spells like Monstrous Rage and Might of the Meek to make them even more threatening. Slickshot Show-Off and Leyline of Resonance act as additional sources of damage. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and allow for smooth curve progression. Overall, the goal is to win the game as fast as possible through the use of efficient aggression.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt opponents while maintaining board presence and gaining incremental advantage through life gain and card draw effects. The strategy involves stalling the game with removal spells like Lay Down Arms and Get Lost, while generating value with creatures like Sanguine Evangelist and Beza, the Bounding Spring. The deck also includes cards like Virtue of Loyalty and Caretaker's Talent to protect its own creatures and maintain a strong defensive position. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition and efficient resource management.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and instant spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes cards like Felonious Rage and Monstrous Rage to boost the power of your creatures, while Leyline of Resonance and Turn Inside Out provide additional damage. The creatures in the deck, such as Cacophony Scamp and Heartfire Hero, are low-cost and have abilities that help push through damage. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and efficient aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent, with the goal of overwhelming them before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck includes efficient creatures with haste and direct damage spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. It also has some late-game threats to ensure a continuous stream of threats. With a low mana curve and a focus on speed, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible through relentless aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of removal and disruption spells, along with powerful creatures like Kaya, Intangible Slayer. The deck focuses on dismantling the opponent's strategy with cards like Assassin's Trophy and Tear Asunder, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Heaped Harvest and Deadly Cover-Up. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency in casting spells, while providing a mix of colors for the various requirements of the cards in the deck. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and strategic play.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively build up a board presence with small but efficient creatures, buffing them up with aura spells like Ethereal Armor and Fae Flight to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck also includes some spells for protection and card advantage. The mana base is focused on providing a good balance between the different colors needed for the deck's spells. Overall, the strategy is to put the pressure on the opponent early and maintain it with a steady stream of threats and answers.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and protective spells. By using cards like Sheltered by Ghosts and Venerated Rotpriest to protect key creatures like Mockingbird and Crawling Chorus, the deck aims to maintain board presence while applying consistent pressure. Additionally, cards like Serum Snare and Bring the Ending provide removal options to deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes cards like Skrelv, Defector Mite and Fleeting Reflection to provide versatility and disruption to the opponent's game plan.

The main theme of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with a variety of low-cost and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Through a combination of efficient creature spells, combat tricks, and mana acceleration, the deck aims to apply constant pressure to the opponent, forcing them to react defensively or risk falling behind. The deck also includes a mix of control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing the aggro creatures to push through damage and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures with aggressive abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining creatures like Cheeky House-Mouse, Flowerfoot Swordmaster, and Emberheart Challenger with combat tricks like Monstrous Rage and Might of the Meek, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. Cards like Sheltered by Ghosts provide protection for key creatures, while lands like Inspiring Vantage and Battlefield Forge ensure consistent mana sources for a fast-paced aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck prioritizes early aggression and efficient combat interactions to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells that disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing creatures with abilities that can control the board, such as Spyglass Siren and Faerie Mastermind, and powerful spells like Go for the Throat and Anoint with Affliction, the goal is to quickly overpower the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Enduring Curiosity and Mockingbird for card advantage and resilience. With a strong mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to maintain a fast-paced tempo while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a steady stream of aggressive creatures to apply pressure. The deck includes various creatures with disruptive abilities like Faerie Mastermind and Spyglass Siren, as well as removal spells like Go for the Throat and Disfigure to deal with threats. The deck also includes cards like Enduring Curiosity and Anoint with Affliction to draw cards and generate value. By combining disruption with aggression, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, while utilizing evasion and card draw to maintain pressure. The deck aims to control the board with removal and counterspells, while also pushing damage through with flying creatures and unblockable effects. By combining the aggression of an aggro deck with the control elements of Dimir colors, this deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a quick clock to close out the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing control spells and cards to dominate the battlefield, preventing opponents from making crucial plays and gaining board advantage. It combines powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archangel of Wrath with support spells like Leyline Binding and Temporary Lockdown to maintain control while building up your own resources. The diverse lands and spells allow for flexibility in mana usage and strategy, creating a versatile gameplay experience that can adapt to various situations and opponents.

The deck focuses on creating a strong control environment by utilizing a variety of cards that allow you to disrupt your opponent's strategy while building up your own resources. With a mixture of creatures, spells, and lands that provide protection and card advantage, the deck aims to outlast your opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By carefully managing your resources and timing your plays effectively, you can establish dominance on the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize low-cost creatures with high aggression to quickly overwhelm your opponent. By using cards like Iridescent Vinelasher and Mosswood Dreadknight, you can quickly build up a strong board presence. The inclusion of removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down helps to keep your opponent's board clear while pushing forward with your own creatures. Cards like Duress and Anoint with Affliction help to disrupt your opponent's strategy while maintaining pressure. Liliana of the Veil and Nissa, Ascended Animist provide additional value and support for your aggro strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing removal spells and control cards to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. By playing cards like Glissa Sunslayer and Archfiend of the Dross, the player can generate additional value and pressure the opponent. Utilizing cards like Vraska, Betrayal's Sting and Cut Down, the player can efficiently remove threats and prevent the opponent from developing their board. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and ramp options to ensure a consistent flow of resources throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle by using low-cost creatures and combat tricks. The deck relies on building a board presence quickly and using cards like Monstrous Rage and Turn Inside Out to pump up creatures for massive damage. The inclusion of cards like Leyline of Resonance and Karplusan Forest help to ensure the deck runs smoothly and efficiently. With a mix of direct damage spells and combat modifiers, this deck aims to finish off opponents before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on using low-cost creatures with abilities like haste and prowess to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Monstrous Rage and Might of the Meek enhance the creatures' power, while Turn Inside Out can provide a surprise boost. Leyline of Resonance helps to maintain board presence, and Witch's Mark provides protection. The mana base is built around ensuring consistent access to both red and green mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive tempo. Utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures like Imodane's Recruiter and Novice Inspector, as well as impactful spells like Resolute Reinforcements and Protect the Negotiators, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain momentum throughout the game. The addition of cards like Spyglass Siren and Gleeful Demolition provide disruption and removal to further support the aggressive strategy. By controlling the board and applying constant pressure, this deck aims to secure a quick victory against opponents.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By combining powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, the deck aims to control the board while dealing heavy damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Duress and Anoint with Affliction also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing for a faster clock to secure victory. Sheoldred's Edict provides additional removal, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a defense against this aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board with a combination of removal spells, creature abilities, and enchantments. The deck aims to keep the opponent's threats at bay while building up its own board presence through strong creatures like Archangel Elspeth and Enduring Innocence. The inclusion of cards like Split Up, Caretaker's Talent, and Get Lost allow for disruption of the opponent's strategy, while cards like Sunfall and Season of the Burrow provide additional protection and card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through efficient control tactics.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combination of vampire bats, powerful legendary creatures, removal spells, and hand disruption cards creates a fast-paced and versatile strategy. Emphasis is on maintaining pressure through constant creature presence while utilizing removal and disruption to keep the opponent on the back foot. The deck also includes a few high-impact planeswalkers to further assist in controlling the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Terror Tide, The Cruelty of Gix, and Founding the Third Path. Cards like Squirming Emergence and Wail of the Forgotten help to fuel your graveyard while cards like Bitter Triumph and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide additional value when creatures are reanimated. Picklock Prankster can disrupt your opponent's strategy while Fallaji Archaeologist can help to find key pieces for your combo. The deck is designed to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures early in the game.

This deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with creatures, then bringing them back to the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing various spells and abilities to put creatures into the graveyard and reanimate them, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence that is difficult to deal with. The combination of sacrifice effects, reanimation spells, and powerful creatures allows for explosive turns and the potential to win the game in a single swing. Patience and strategic timing are crucial to effectively execute the combo and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard manipulation and reanimation spells to bring back powerful creatures to the battlefield. It includes cards that enable the player to fill their graveyard quickly and efficiently, as well as creatures with powerful abilities that can swing the game in their favor once they are reanimated. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure a balance of mana sources and colors needed to cast its spells effectively.
